      • notNull

        public static <T> T notNull(T obj,
                            String errorMessage,
                            Object... errorMessageArgs)
        Ensures that an object reference passed as a parameter to the calling method is not null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        obj - an object reference
        errorMessage - a template for the exception message should the check fail. The message is formed by replacing each %s placeholder in the template with an argument. These are matched by position - the first %s gets errorMessageArgs[0], etc. Unmatched arguments will be appended to the formatted message in square braces. Unmatched placeholders will be left as-is.
        errorMessageArgs - the arguments to be substituted into the message template. Arguments are converted to strings using String.valueOf(Object).
        Returns:
        the non-null reference that was validated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if obj is null

      • notNullOrEmpty

        public static <T> T notNullOrEmpty(T obj)

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        obj - an object reference
        Returns:
        the non-null and not empty reference that was validated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if obj is null or empty

      • notNullOrEmpty

        public static <T> T notNullOrEmpty(T obj,
                                   String errorMessage,
                                   Object... errorMessageArgs)
        Ensures that an object reference passed as a parameter to the calling method is not null and not empty.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        obj - an object reference
        errorMessage - a template for the exception message should the check fail. The message is formed by replacing each %s placeholder in the template with an argument. These are matched by position - the first %s gets errorMessageArgs[0], etc. Unmatched arguments will be appended to the formatted message in square braces. Unmatched placeholders will be left as-is.
        errorMessageArgs - the arguments to be substituted into the message template. Arguments are converted to strings using String.valueOf(Object).
        Returns:
        the non-null and not empty reference that was validated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if obj is null or empty

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        obj - an object reference
        parameterName - the parameter name to use in exception message if the check fails. Message: "parameter 'parameterName' must not be null!"

        the non-null reference that was validated

      • isParamNullOrEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isParamNullOrEmpty(T obj)
        Ensures the truth that an object reference passed as a parameter to the calling method is null or empty
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type
        Parameters:
        obj - an object reference (Objects, Arrays, Collections, String etc. and also Arrays of primitive types)
        Returns:
        the true if the given object is null or empty, false otherwise

      • expression

        public static void expression(boolean expression)
        Ensures the truth of an expression involving one or more parameters to the calling method.
        Parameters:
        expression - a boolean expression
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if expression is false

      • expression

        public static void expression(boolean expression,
                              Object errorMessage)
        Ensures the truth of an expression involving one or more parameters to the calling method.
        Parameters:
        expression - a boolean expression
        errorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if expression is false

      • expression

        public static void expression(boolean expression,
                              String errorMessage,
                              Object... errorMessageArgs)
        Ensures the truth of an expression involving one or more parameters to the calling method.
        Parameters:
        expression - a boolean expression
        errorMessage - a template for the exception message should the check fail. The message is formed by replacing each %s placeholder in the template with an argument. These are matched by position - the first %s gets errorMessageArgs[0], etc. Unmatched arguments will be appended to the formatted message in square braces. Unmatched placeholders will be left as-is.
        errorMessageArgs - the arguments to be substituted into the message template. Arguments are converted to strings using String.valueOf(Object).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if expression is false or if the check fails and either errorMessageTemplate or errorMessageArgs is null (don't let this happen)
